---
title: Decimal
---

import Badge from "~/components/en/Badge.astro";

The `Decimal` class represents arbitrary-precision real numbers. In the `standard` preset, it inherits from the [`big.js`](https://github.com/MikeMcl/big.js) class. This may cause inconsistencies in the results of methods such as `.toString()` across different presets.

### Import

```ts
import { Decimal } from "@tai-kun/surrealdb/data-types/decode-only";
import { Decimal } from "@tai-kun/surrealdb/data-types/encodable";
import { Decimal } from "@tai-kun/surrealdb/data-types/standard";
```

### `.constructor()`

Creates a new `Decimal` object.

```ts
new Decimal(source: string); // decode-only, encodable
new Decimal(source: string | number | Decimal); // standard
```

#### Arguments

##### `source`

A real number represented as a string. If the preset is `standard`, a numeric value can also be provided.

#### Return Value

When called through `new`, `Decimal` returns its instance.

### `.toString()` <Badge variant="instance" /><Badge variant="method" /><Badge variant="decodeonly" />

Gets the real number as a string.

#### Arguments

None.

#### Return Value

Returns a string representation of the real number.

### `.toSurql()` <Badge variant="instance" /><Badge variant="method" /><Badge variant="encodable" />

Converts a `Decimal` object to a string that can be embedded in SurrealQL. Similar to `.toString()`, but adds a `dec` suffix to inform the query parser that the string is a `decimal` type.

```ts
.toSurql(): string;
```

#### Arguments

None.

#### Return Value

Returns the real number with the `dec` suffix.

#### Example

```ts
import { Decimal } from "@tai-kun/surrealdb/data-types/encodable";

const decimal = new Decimal("3.14");
console.log(decimal.toSurql());
//-> 3.14dec
```

### `.clone()` <Badge variant="instance" /><Badge variant="method" /><Badge variant="standard" />

Clones a `Decimal` object.

```ts
.clone(): this;
```

#### Arguments

None.

#### Return Value

Returns a new `Decimal` object. If the `Decimal` class is extended, an instance of that class is returned.

### Other Methods

If you are using the `standard` preset, the `Decimal` class inherits from the `big.js` `Big` class.  Therefore, instance methods and properties should be consulted in the `big.js` documentation:

[`big.js` Documentation](https://mikemcl.github.io/big.js/#prototype-methods)

### Development

#### Generic Determination of `Decimal` Objects

It is recommended to use the `isDecimal` function to determine if a value is a `Decimal` object without relying on presets. This function does not use `instanceof`, making it useful when the preset of the value being checked is unknown.

```ts
import { isDecimal } from "@tai-kun/surrealdb";
```
